floor.name: Steel-Reinforced Concrete (RCC) Floor
floor.description: Best overall balance for earthquakes, ash load, and typhoon stability.

performance.flood: Dense concrete resists water exposure; prolonged flooding can promote steel corrosion if reinforcement is poorly covered. Use good cover, proper curing, and waterproofing.
performance.ground-shaking: Steel reinforcement provides ductility and tensile capacity, reducing brittle cracking and improving seismic performance.
performance.ashfall: High load capacity supports added vertical loads from ash accumulation.
performance.typhoon: Heavy, rigid slab improves stability and resists uplift/lateral vibration when tied into structural frame.

pros: Good load-bearing capacity for ash accumulation
Excellent uplift and lateral force resistance
cons: Requires skilled labor and proper detailing
Risk of corrosion if waterproofing is poor

floor.name: Cement Backer Board Floor
floor.description: Non-combustible, water-resistant underlayment. Best used as a layer within a system, not as main structural floor.

performance.flood: Water- and mold-resistant; maintains integrity as a base layer.
performance.ground-shaking: Stable, rigid base can reduce tile/finish cracking when installed correctly.

cons: Limited structural capacity as standalone floor
Best used as a substrate layer

floor.name: Plain Cement Concrete (PCC) Floor
floor.description: Simple and cost-effective; strong in compression but less crack-resistant than RCC.

performance.flood: Dense surface tolerates temporary submersion; cracks may form with prolonged exposure and movement.
performance.ground-shaking: Can handle moderate shaking if thick and well-cured, but more prone to cracking vs RCC.
performance.ashfall: Non-combustible; can carry ash loads reasonably well.

cons: More prone to cracking than RCC
Risk of cracks from prolonged flooding

floor_system.name: Reinforced Concrete Floor System
floor_system.description: Integrated RC system with proper connections and reinforcement.

performance.flood: Durable and water-tolerant for temporary exposure.
performance.ground-shaking: Performs well with correct reinforcement and connections.
performance.ashfall: Supports ash/debris loads; easy to clean.
performance.typhoon: Resists uplift and lateral forces when integrated into building frame.

floor_system.name: Suspended / Raised Floor
floor_system.description: Best advantage is flood protection by elevating living space.

performance.flood: Water passes underneath; reduces damage to interior floors.
performance.ground-shaking: Can perform well if properly braced and connected to columns/beams.
performance.ashfall: Ash generally affects roof more than floors; elevated floors protect interiors from ash/mud at ground level.

pros: Reduced ash/mud entry to living areas
cons: Needs robust anchorage to prevent sway
Moderate uplift resistance (less than solid systems)

floor_system.name: Timber Floor System
floor_system.description: Lightweight and flexible; needs moisture protection.

performance.flood: Vulnerable to prolonged wetting unless elevated, sealed, and treated.
performance.ground-shaking: Light weight reduces seismic demand; flexibility can reduce brittle failure.
performance.ashfall: Must be protected from fine ash intrusion and moisture.

pros: Flexible construction can reduce brittle failure
cons: Susceptible to ash and moisture intrusion

foundation.name: Pile Foundation with Reinforced Concrete
foundation.applicableHazards: Flood, ground shaking, soil erosion, drought, ashfall
foundation.description: Deep foundation transferring loads to stable soil/rock.

performance.flood: Reduces reliance on flood-weakened surface soils.
performance.ground-shaking: Helps reduce differential settlement; strong uplift and lateral resistance.

pros: Excellent for flood-prone and coastal areas
Good earthquake resistance when properly designed

foundation.name: Pier Foundation with Reinforced Concrete
foundation.applicableHazards: Flood, ground shaking, soil erosion, drought
foundation.description: Short vertical supports elevating the structure above flood level.

performance.flood: Elevates living space above water level.
performance.ground-shaking: Some movement tolerance, but depends on detailing.
performance.drought: Reduced cracking from minor soil movement.

cons: Typically less robust than piles for extreme seismic/wind demands
Requires proper detailing for good performance
Less suitable for very soft soils

foundation.name: Plain Concrete with Stone Aggregate Foundation
foundation.description: Durable and economical under moderate demands.

performance.ground-shaking: Limited crack/bending resistance.

cons: Lower crack/bending resistance than reinforced concrete

wall.name: Reinforced Concrete (RC) Wall System
wall.description: RC walls with steel reinforcement acting as load-bearing and lateral-force-resisting elements.

performance.ground-shaking: Effective lateral system; strong stiffness with ductile detailing.
performance.typhoon: Resists high wind pressure and debris impact.
performance.flood: More moisture-tolerant than many lightweight systems.
performance.ashfall: Supports increased loads transferred from roof/walls.

pros: Excellent seismic performance with proper detailing
cons: Poor thermal insulation without additional materials
Requires skilled labor for proper reinforcement

wall.name: Confined Masonry Wall System
wall.description: Masonry units confined by RC tie columns and tie beams.

performance.ground-shaking: Improved performance versus unreinforced masonry due to confinement.
performance.typhoon: Handles moderate wind loads when properly tied and anchored.
performance.flood: Durable in wet conditions with good plastering/waterproofing.

pros: More economical than full RC walls
Good wind resistance when properly detailed
cons: Generally less ductile than full RC walls
Less robust than full RC in severe earthquakes/typhoons
Requires expert detailing for high-hazard areas

wall.name: Concrete Hollow Block (CHB) Wall
wall.description: Economical and lighter than solid concrete, but needs strong reinforcement.

performance.ground-shaking: Can work well if properly reinforced, grouted, and anchored.

cons: Without strong detailing, can underperform in severe hazards
More prone to cracking than solid RC

roof.name: Hip Roof with Metal Roofing
roof.applicableHazards: Typhoon, ground shaking, ashfall, heavy rain
roof.description: Sloped roof in all directions with strong wind performance, good drainage, and ash shedding.

performance.typhoon: Reduced uplift due to aerodynamic form; performs well under wind from multiple directions.
performance.ground-shaking: Stable geometry; lower collapse tendency when well-connected.
performance.ashfall: Sloped planes help ash slide off, reducing overload risk.

pros: Excellent wind resistance for typhoon-prone areas
Metal roofing sheds ash fall effectively
Effective ash shedding from sloped planes
cons: Metal can be noisy during heavy rain
Requires proper installation to prevent leaks
Complex joint design needs careful detailing

roof.name: Metal Roofing Material
roof.description: Lightweight, durable metal covering for excellent hazard performance.

performance.typhoon: High wind resistance when screwed/fastened correctly to braced framing.
performance.ashfall: Smooth surface sheds ash; coating helps resist acidic ash corrosion.

pros: High wind resistance when properly fastened
cons: Noise during heavy rain (mitigated with sound dampening)

roof.name: Dutch Gable Roof
roof.description: Provides attic space/light but adds complex joints.

performance.flood-rain: Good runoff, but seams are more leak-prone.
performance.ground-shaking: More complexity and some added weight can increase vulnerability.
performance.ashfall: Ridges/joints can collect ash and clog drainage.
performance.typhoon: Good if reinforced, but gable portions can be more wind-sensitive.

pros: Provides attic space and additional headroom
Good water runoff when designed well
cons: Ash traps at ridges and junctions

roof.name: Clay Tile Roofing
roof.description: Heavy, traditional roofing with good water repellency.

performance.ground-shaking: Heavy mass increases seismic forces significantly (main drawback).
performance.typhoon: Only good if every tile is clipped/wired correctly; can become windborne debris.

cons: Heavy mass significantly increases seismic forces
Can become windborne debris if not perfectly secured
Requires every tile to be clipped/wired in high wind areas
Brittle; tiles can crack from earthquakes

beam.name: Reinforced Concrete Beam with Steel Reinforcement
beam.description: Structural beams with proper reinforcement detailing for multi-hazard performance.

performance.ground-shaking: Good seismic performance with proper reinforcement and ductile detailing.
performance.typhoon: Resists lateral forces from wind and provides stability.

pros: Good seismic performance with proper detailing
Can provide both vertical and lateral support

tie-beam.name: Reinforced Concrete Tie Beam
tie-beam.applicableHazards: Ground shaking, ground movement, ashfall, typhoon
tie-beam.description: Horizontal member connecting columns to improve overall integrity and distribute loads.

performance.ground-shaking: Reduces column spreading; improves seismic behavior.
performance.ground-movement: Helps prevent frame separation if one area shifts.
performance.ashfall: Helps distribute added roof loads; reduces cracking risk.

cons: Requires careful coordination with other elements

lintel-beam.name: Reinforced Concrete Lintel Beam
lintel-beam.description: Beam supporting wall loads over doors and windows to prevent collapse above openings.

performance.ground-shaking: Prevents collapse above openings during seismic motion.
performance.typhoon: Protects openings from deformation under pressure.
performance.ashfall: Transfers roof/wall loads away from weak opening frames.

pros: Transfers loads around weak opening areas
Helps prevent frame failure at stress concentrations

column.name: Circular Reinforced Concrete Column
column.applicableHazards: Ground shaking, typhoon, ashfall, ground movement
column.description: Columns with circular cross-section and confinement reinforcement for optimal multi-hazard performance.

performance.ground-shaking: No weak axis; performs well under multi-directional shaking.
performance.typhoon: Smoother wind flow reduces localized pressure; even stress distribution.
performance.ashfall: Better confinement supports heavier axial loads.
performance.ground-movement: Handles irregular lateral pressure more effectively from landslides/settlement.

pros: High compressive strength for multi-story buildings
Excellent earthquake resistance when properly confined
Smoother wind flow reduces local pressures
Can support heavier axial loads from ash accumulation
cons: Slightly more complex formwork than rectangular

column.name: Stilt Column (Elevated Support)
column.description: Vertical supports elevating structure above flood level.

performance.flood: Great for floods by elevating living space.
performance.ground-shaking: Needs strong bracing/anchorage for wind and quakes.
performance.typhoon: Requires robust connections and lateral bracing.

pros: Keeps living areas away from water/debris
cons: Great for floods but needs strong bracing/anchorage for wind and quakes
Limited effectiveness without proper seismic detailing
Must be carefully designed for high wind areas

column.name: Rectangular Reinforced Concrete Column
column.description: Standard rectangular columns with steel reinforcement.

performance.ground-shaking: Has strong and weak axes; requires good reinforcement.
performance.typhoon: Good performance if properly sized and detailed.

cons: Has weak and strong axes; can cause irregular response
Requires careful orientation for bidirectional motion
Less efficient confinement than circular sections
May require larger sections for equivalent performance
